general_advisory: Jagatsinghpur district is likely to receive light to moderate rainfall for the next five days. Keeping rainfall forecast in mind, farmers are advised not to do any type of spray and do proper drainage management in pulse crops and vegetable nurseries. After rainfall recedes, apply top dressing of fertilizers either in transplanted or direct-seeded rice. In case of transplanted rice in low/medium land where top dressing of urea has not been applied, spray 2% urea after rainfall. There are chances of appearance of iron toxicity symptoms due to stagnant water, drain out stagnant water and apply specific fertilizers as needed. Due to the prevailing cloudy weather associated with high humidity, regular monitoring for occurrence of insects and diseases in crops is highly recommended.

advisory: After receding of rainwater, there is a chance of infestation of Swarming Caterpillar. To manage this, spray Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5% EC @ 400-ml/acre or Lambda-cyhalothrin @ 400-ml/acre.

Rainfall after a dry spell may aggravate infestation of fall armyworm in maize. To manage the pest, spray biopesticide Beauveria bassiana @ 1200-gram/acre by mixing in 200-liter of water. Dust mixture of sand, soil, and wooden ash inside the leaf whorl so that the caterpillars cannot feed on the leaves. To manage the pest chemically, spray Emamectin Benzoate 5% S.G @ 80-gram/acre or Spinetoram 11.7% S.C @ 100-ml/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% S.C @ 80-ml/acre. 200-liter of water per acre is required to spray the insecticide.

There are chances of damping off disease in vegetable nursery like tomato, brinjal, chili. To manage it, drench nursery bed with 2-gram Captan/liter of water or 2.5-gram Copper Oxychloride/liter of water.
September is the optimum time for nursery raising of tomato. Grow resistant varieties like BT-2, BT-10, BT-12, Niladri, Sadabahar, Madhuri, Maharathi, Rasmi, Naveen, etc.
To control papaya Crown rot Spray Copper Oxychloride @3 g/liter of water or Carbendazim @1 g/lit or Thiophanate Methyl @1 g/lit at 15 days interval.

Provide drainage. Give staking to plants. For sigatoka disease, spray Mancozeb 75% WP (@ 400-g or Zineb 75% WP @ 400g or Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63% WP @ 400g per acre with 200 liter of water as precautionary measures.
